io.github.georgiosgoniotakis.bluetoothwrapper.library.core

Class BTExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.georgiosgoniotakis.bluetoothwrapper.library.core.BTExplorer

  • public class BTExplorer
extends java.lang.Object
    This it the main file of the BluetoothWrapper library. This class initializes a basic connection with the device's BT adapter and after that it monitors any paired devices. It contains many utility methods which allow the developer to obtain information about any paired devices.

    Please refer to the library's example to get started. This class is implemented following the Thread-Safe Singleton pattern.

    Since:
    12 October 2017
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Georgios Goniotakis

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BTExplorer getInstance(android.os.Handler btHandler)
        Standard getInstance method of Singleton pattern. It is synchronized to be Thread-Safe and uses a @RequiresPermission annotation to remind to the user about the required permissions. Can be initialized with a Handler object to enable passing incoming messages to a given class.

        Parameters:
        btHandler - A Handler for incoming and outgoing messages
        Returns:
        The instance of this class

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported()
        Returns the device's Bluetooth compatibility
        Returns:
        Returns false if the device does not support BT

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns the device's Bluetooth current status
        Returns:
        Returns false if the device's BT is disabled

      • pairedDevices

        public java.util.Set<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> pairedDevices()
        This method produces a Set with all the available Bluetooth devices as BluetoothDevice objects.
        Returns:
        Returns a Set with all the available paired Bluetooth devices.

      • deviceList

        public java.lang.String[][] deviceList(boolean output)
        Produces a printed list with all the paired Bluetooth devices along with their MAC addresses in the information logcat window.
        Parameters:
        output - The developer's preference for logcat logging

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String deviceMAC,
                    Mode mode)
             throws BTDeviceNotFoundException
        Performs all necessary checks and establishes the communication with the requested device.

        The developer passes a MAC address either manually or obtained by the deviceList(boolean) method.

        Parameters:
        deviceMAC - The device's MAC address
        mode - Preferred connection mode (Mode.SECURE or Mode.INSECURE)
        Throws:
        BTDeviceNotFoundException - If the device is not available any more an exception is being thrown

      • connect

        public void connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice,
                    Mode mode)
             throws BTDeviceNotFoundException
        Performs all necessary checks and establishes the communication with the requested device.

        The developer passes the BluetoothDevice object obtained by the pairedDevices() method.

        Parameters:
        btDevice - The bluetooth device
        mode - Preferred connection mode (Mode.SECURE or Mode.INSECURE)
        Throws:
        BTDeviceNotFoundException - If the device is not available any more an exception is being thrown

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String message)
        Use this to send a message to a BT device.
        Parameters:
        message - The message as a String

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Call this every time that you want to disconnect from a connected device.
